titleStmt.title: The Juniper lecturer corrected and his Latin, pagan, putid [sic] nonsence paraphrazed ; also, The coffee scoffer cussed and kicked, or, The pittifull paedagoog's Latin vindication

availability.p: To the extent possible under law, the Text Creation Partnership has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above, according to the terms of the CC0 1.0 Public Domain Dedication (http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/). titleStmt.title: The Juniper lecturer corrected and his Latin, pagan, putid [sic] nonsence paraphrazed ; also, The coffee scoffer cussed and kicked, or, The pittifull paedagoog's Latin vindication

notesStmt.note: "The coffee scoffer cussed and kicked, or, The pittiful paedagoog's Latin vindication" : p. 11-16.
In Latin verse, with introductory fable in English verse.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p: THE JUNIPER LECTURER CORRECTED, And his Latin, Pagan, putid Nonſence PARAPHRAZED.
ALSO, THE COFFEE SCOFFER Cuffed, and Kicked: OR, THE PITTIFULL PAEDAGOOG'S Latin Vindication.

div.head: A FABLE.
div.l: MOths, Bats, Daws, Owles, ambitiouſly did ſeek
To ſpeak pure Latin, learn the copious Greek.
The one they chatter'd rudely, but the other
They knew no more, then the blind-born doth color.
But to conclude, they ſelf-conceited were;
And challenged their betters, without fear.
The Cuckow, Parot, they to match did think;
But either theſe, did make them all to ſtink.
The Cuckow learnt ſo much, that he ſpake Greek
More in an hour, then they did in a week.
But the rare Parot ſpake the tongues ſo high,
That made them all with envy for to cry;
Come no more Parot to us; leſt this don,
We rub your bunch-back in the ſcorching ſun.
They made the Bird a Camel. Thus we ſee
Fools, Knaves, Sots, Pimps, publiſh 〈…〉
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 ,
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .
VApulat Orbilius: quis? & à quo? ſalpa ſalivans!
Te Corydone ſubex, torta flagella teram?
Iuniperive cibo tineis lectura magiſtro.
Sed tua juniperus toxica tetra tegit.
Edita 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 per ſcribam. Verna Lyaeo
Se dicat; heſternum non olet iſte merum.
Evion, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , patientem ferre dolores,
Ebrius oggannit. Blax Acheronta ciet.
Eſt regale probis à te mala ſcire cinaedo,
Indoles eximium cui negat eſſe pilum.
Oedipon & Sphingem glomeras, Centaure biformis!
Veri blatta capax exulat ore tropus.
Quam te delectat, ſcurrilis ſimia Clivi,
Fundere probroſis plauſtra referta dolis!
• commata cudendi tentat praecordia fervor:
Me lupa nutrivit, me genuitque draco.
Qui tibi ſuggeſſit rabidos reboare furores,
Praecipitem, caveas, ne det in omne nefas.
• ur tibi reſcribam, nihil eſt rationis habendum:
Denuò rixanti, ſarda, ſilere reor.
Saepius allatras mihi flagrio flegmina, nates,
Quàm ſenſere graves chara caterva volas.
Arguit hoc puerum ſceleri vixiſſe ſubactum,
Crudas vibices commaculâſſe cutim.
Heu ructas, ſputas, hirris, paedantius audit
Infimus hic, cum quo bella cruenta gero.
Deſpicis abſimilem quemvis tibi, ſordide leno,
E quorum numero glorior eſſe ratum.
Perdite perjuras, me quid cuculâſſe nitentes
In Grotii titulos, collutulâſſe genus.
Praepoſuiſſe ſty lo fateor documenta laborum:
Hinc illae lachrymae profiluere mihi.
Me ſilicem mendax tranſcendere daemona damnas,
Vejovis & matrem. Nonne Car ipſe paves?
Vulnera, tela, faces peſſundator arma minatur,
Invocat & furias, queis agitatur hebes.
Quid tibi, monticolae nocuerunt, combibo, Cambri?
Gutture quos patulo contumulare ſitis.
Compedibus carioſe fremis me Thraſo teneri▪
Te curaturum, ſi tua menda querar.
Non feralis hylax lunam latratibus urget:
Corvus & ignorat, quod reſonare ſolet.
Sic tu colluvies creperâ raucedine mugis,
Quae moveant riſus, parturiant que ſtrophas.
Quonam jure decet fatuum ſartago loquendi?
Scribendi ſcabies quâ juvat arte pecus?
Quicquid te decorat, vitiat me; lurco reluctans,
Imperat ingenio trux Libitina Getae.
Porce voras glandes, tamen helluo ſuſpice quercum,
E qua proveniunt pabula grata gulae.
Nativum ſpeculo videas Epicure colorem:
Dirigat enormes coelica ſuada Vias.
Rorida vulnificis vernant viridaria ramis,
Suavia ſpinoſi dant melimela rubi.
Arborei foetus digitis removentur in alto,
Non reſidi, reduci ſerta liganda rati.
Sudanti, non torpenti favet ardua coelum:
Quiſquis edit panem, non fugit ille molam.
Cur ſcopulos ſulco? quid arenae ſemina mando?
Serpenti ſurdo cantica caſta cano.
Corripis immeritum furti me, rana coaxans,
Non ego te furem defero, multa reum.
Stultitiam memoras capitalibus ipſe figuris:
In me livor edax fulmina bruta tonas.
Fellea metra dolas epulo, licitaris acumen:
Sortitur ſegnes coeca latrina modos.
Si ſocors vocitere, ſalis, minitare, citaris:
Quilibet inſipidus buccinat, alta ſapis.
Conceptus cecinere tui, ludibria ventis
Te fore calcatum, prave ſaperda, ſalem.
Quinam conceptus, regeris? date ſpicula manes,
Ut mittam furvis, qui mihi pugnat, aquis.
Si ſermo mentem pingit, ſi fata repandit,
Naſceris ipſe pati ferre tributa bulo.
Nuper Grammaticum, ſed nunc ego divido furcam:
Abſint auguriis omina certa Magi.
• atum fico cenſes diſcindere vocem,
Nunc gratare Cilix me ſecuiſſe crucem.
• nicus appares, ſty gio paeane triumphas,
Non linget, terget poſteriora mihi.
Nolo crabrones, nolo laetamina tangi;
Gallus fimetum non ego ruspor: abi.
Tranquillant choleram Praecepta, fugantque timorem:
Hem tibi, rixando Phyllida tortor emis.
Hexametris & Pentametris modulabor Iambos;
Aeri aurum, ſolidos aereoliſque dabo.
Ne mirere comes, ſine punctis bombilat atrox;
Amiſit ſtimulum veſpa moleſta ſuum.
Eja age ſtercoreo libemus vina Tonanti,
Nec non coelitibus ſubditiore gradu.
Pandamusſacrum celeres matrique Vacunae.
Incipit ariolus ſollicitare Lares.
Occidit occiſor fiſco, dominator honorus
Clarior aetherei fulgurat igne tholi.
Provocat Entellum Dares certamine coeſtus,
Succubuit, ſterilem dente momordit humum.
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 ,
Ludimagiſter hiat caſſior arte cocis.
Paganus veterum violat ſacraria Vatum,
Luxatus lacero carmine. Lector, ovo.
Pris bovicida blatis à me tolerare cianum:
O r • bor! ô facinus! penna proterva tace.
Dux dichoraeus erat (ſic triſtia fata tulerunt)
Splendidus à modulis decapitatur avus.
Sordibus immodicis latices immiſcuit ultor.
Pulchra triumphalem cinge tiara comam.
Lerna Brittannorum populi, mendice vagaris,
Morbida ſus pepcrit tenothon inter haras.
Armiger aut miles, qui talia ſpargere de me
Audeat, ignotum ſe ſciat eſſe ſibi.
Hiſtrio treſſis, epôn ſutor, flagrique dynaſta,
Hircoſe ô Maevi, nauſea dira ſtygis.
Quem Deus ac homines oderunt, flebile monſ • rū:
Si prior immittit, vexat aſilus equum.
Speras te niveo curru pulſare ſedentem,
Vertice ſublato ſidera ſumma colum?
Stellas Evantiſque (viri proh numina quanti)
Sectantes umbram lambere? graecor Arabs.
I, licet ad cuculi celſis in montibus urbem,
O tu terreni rudus, amurca fori!
Iſtius & tandem conſors faciende popelli,
Occine tu nugas, funereoſque tonos.
I crucis ipſe cliens, crepitans febrile cerebrum,
Literio properus litera longa cluas,
Strinxeris ut la queo collum. Delator anilis
Quae mala conſpirat, talia paſſus obit.
Quid varias crebro juvenum tu verbere clunes?
Sed cur non mores corrigis ipſe Ligur?
Bellua laeva rudis quid adhuc in pulvere docto?
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .
Te fungum jactas, ſanus quem reſpuit omnis;
Non tibi palpatur quis, niſi Maccus hilum.
Abnue vitupero notum temerare Lycaeum
Clamorem ſolitum comprime: fare mador.
Pſittacus ampla loquax criticas exulcerat aures,
Exoſus daemon qui capularis erit;
Qui pia profuſo ſubſannat vota cachinno,
Ad ritus ſacri nolit adire chori.
Turba magiſtrorum tumidis è faucibus hiſcens:
Heupudor, heu pietas, juſque, fideſque jacent!
Deſine, nam ſi tu latratus ederis uſquam,
Gibbum torrenti ſole Camele fricem.
Ciuribus illiſam cautus vereare ſecurim,
Quam geris accenſam. Mens pecuina peri.
Te fera fortè feram ſtreperum diffundere mur-mur
Ore fero, famam me lacerare tuam:
Quae nec erat, radios quo primo tempore cernis,
Quae nec erit, rutilus dum rotat aſtra polus.
Non moror ipſe tuas bipedum faexima querelas,
Quem nemo novit, quin tua probra putat,
Verſibus haud novies centenis poſſe referri.
Dens, frons, vox ſtudiis conſervere latus.
Archilochus cedat Naſoni, Zoilus Homero,
Lappa roſae, ceraſo cornus, erica nuci.
Omne micans aurum non eſt: metire Lycambis
Dramata, comperies aſperiora meis.

div.head: Paean Triumphalis.
div.l: Io libemus merum Coprio Jovi,
Et diis minorum Gentium;
2 Cloacinaeque matri pandamas Sacrum,
Quippe occidit pedantius;
3 Jacetque pueri dextra confoſſus Dares
Mordens arenam dentibus:
4 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 :
Magiſter ignorantiae;
5 Qui ſemi paganus ſacra Vatum polluit
Lacinioſo carmine;
6 Et puriores rivulos immiſcuit
Smectimnianis ſordib • s.
7 Circumforaneum vah mendicabulum
Labes popelli Cambrici!
8 Quem Campis faetidum g • rguſhidon▪
Enixa fertur ſpurca ſus:
9 Trioboiaris histrio; metri ſutor
Flagri Dynaſtes peſsime;
10 Hircine maevi; terrae ac caelorum odium,
Cerberi fastidium;
11 Speras te curru conſidentem eburneo
Ferire ſummo Vertice
12 Stellas, eaſque Evantis (proh quanti viri)
Umbram ſequaces lambere!
13 I, l • cet ad urbem cuculorum in nubibus
Mortalium stultiſsime!
14 Et tandem conſors factus istius chori
Effunde nugas, Naenias:
15 I candidate crucis, oſtentans, leve &
Febriculoſum ingenium:
16 I literator, longa fias litera
Cum fune collum obſtrinxeris,
17 Quid variaris crebro clunes verbere
Mores tuos nec corrigis;
18 Quid rudis adhuc erudito in pulvere
Inviſa nobis bellua?
19 Jactaſve cum te ſanus quiſque deſpicit
Maccique ſoli-palpitant.
20 Abſiſte Mome nota ab Academia
Solitumque hiatum comprime,
21 Nobis dicaces pſittaci bilem movent
Et capulares Daemones;
22 Et qui nefando riſu ſubſannant preces
Rituſque ſacrae eccleſiae;
23 Et inficeti paedagoguli gregis
Ore strepentes turgido:
24 Abſiſte ne ſi te baubantem audivero
In ſole Gibbum refricem;
25 Neve aſcia illidatur cruribus tuis
Quam tute ſuccenſam geris.
26 Ferate murmur ore forſan putrido tibi
Tuoque mox exaudiam,
27 Me probri accuſans quod famam lacer •
Cui fama nulla eſt aut erit:
28 Aſt tuas querelas non morabor tetricas
Quam nemo ſit quin noverit
29 Tuas non poſſe traloqui impuricias
Nec ter trecentis verſibus.

div.head: THE COFFEE SCOFFER Cuffed, and kicked: OR, THE PITTIFUL PAEDAGOOG'S Latin Vindication.

l.hi: What Mome, and Matter, tell me Friend with ſpeed,
Doth ſcribble Lies, and filthy Flies doth feed?
Who hath no Wit, no Worth, no Grace, no Shame.

div.l: MAlè feriati plagipatidae delumbans fuſtigatio.
Comitantur praelia prelis.
Pro captu lectoris habent ſua fata libelli.

lg.head: Aenigma.
lg.l: Quid Momi, quid Materiae, mihi narret amicus

lg.head: Solutio.
lg.l: Lana creat tineas, Nebulonem nominat Anglis,
Cui pudor, ingenium, gratia, candor abeſt.

div.l: 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .
SIccine, ſcurra ferox, miſerum maciare magiſtrum
Te juvat? innocuos exagitare viros?
Ac ſi Cerbereis turgerent pectora diris,
Inficeret fibras torva Megaera tuas.
Nulla palaephatiis miſces medicamina char • is,
Nec quid habes genii lucidioris iners.
Putida mentiris, blandiris: Tullius illum
Judicat illepidum, cui tua lingua litat.
Prodigium humani generis, non candidus extat
Grotius; aſt patrii gemma, decuſque ſoli,
Audiat iſte licet talis, capitalia patrans
Crimina, quae ſummo torta rigore gemunt.
Tu tamen ô palpo laudas, deliria jactas,
Abderitanis futiliora jocis.
Indiget Hellebor • qui te veneratur ineptum:
Naviget 〈◊〉 , qui tua metra probat.
Frons index anim • titulus dicatur opellae:
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 nemo vertice ſanus ait.
Non torquatus eques, cui tu famularis, & aſtas,
Promeret ad ſannas talia dicta ſuas.
Non mihi certatur, ſed diſſertatur, & illi:
A ſtupet ille ſtylo, materiae ſed ego.
Singula quid referam? multis convenimus ambo;
Et diſceſſuris pangitur alma charis.
Sed tu felle truci reboans cerebroſus alaſtor,
Conturbas ſocii jura, fidemque chori.
Ibide Naſonis truculentior ipſe notaris:
Hic libertatem, tu rapis eſſe mihi.
Depecularis inops vitam, victum; nec amictum
Barbarus indulges: Thrax violente furis.
Nigra Cytheriacum ma • ulant ſpecularia cygnum,
Luridus ingenuas fuſcat ocellus opes.
Me monſtrum vocitas; protruſo daemonis ano
Os vapor aſſimilas; jurgia rauca rugis.
Me cyclope crepas portentum turpius ullo:
Deficit illicibus dia Minerva genis.
Negligis haud naſum, Veneris lue fingis adeſum;
Diſpereat, Paphiae qui vaga luſtra petit.
Obturat capitis nares pituita, ſed iſtas
Eximit, heu moechi ſtigma, ſagitta cohi.
Non ego depereo dominas, non oſcula venor;
Eſt mihi muſaeum curia, ſponſa liber.
Rabula quid facias? ſciolorum fautor onagrum
Te jugat, & luſus abdicat ille tuos.
Priſ bovicida blatis à me tolerare cianum,
Nec non diſcipulos plurima flere meos.
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 !
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 ;
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .
Pygotribam, non paedotribam, me bucco laceſſis:
A non plagoſis Ludio lora luas.
Vilis adulator pecudum eſt, oſorque ferarum
Peſſimus, alterutro foedior Hibris erit.
Vade age, vappa fugax, oras appelle remotas;
Ne te carnificis caedat iniqua manus.
Nunc tibi ſint comites laqueï; nunc monſtret obeſus
Cerdo furciferum; vindicet ipſe puer,
Quem modo ſulphureïs ſufflabas invidus armis,
Illius ac ſtruerent livor & ira necem.
Spiritus eſt vindex numen: te vidit agentem
Falſidicum ſtygii facta profana vadi.
Prodis in expanſum recidens lita ſimia ſputum,
Quod peccatorem coecat & angit herum.
Foeta cruoribibos metuunt armenta leones,
Subruma carnivoro deviat agna lupo.
Saucia fulminei minitantur vulnera pardi,
Hiſpidus imbelles eſurit urſus oves.
Milvus & accipiter tremulos generantur ad ictus;
Turtur, olor, perdix, & philomela, quient.
Scilicet in terris remanet concordia diſcors:
Huic quod paſtus erit, moeror & horror ei.
Sic ſibi muſca ſalax dapibus ſaturatur inemptis,
Sed formica tenax, ſedula ſudat apis.
Quid tu, fuce vorax, telluris inutile pondus,
Mancipium vitii, ſtercus, oleta, paras?
Sons epulor, bacchor, meretricor, acerbor, odoror,
Quaduplor, ampullor, lurcor, apricor, aquor.
Rectores juvenum ſordent tibi, treſſis agaſo,
Clangitur hos aris, hos ſtuduiſſe focis.
Nugero, ganeo, gnatho, gulo, balatroque, ſuſurro,
Gaudent pacificos inſimulare procos.
Non ego percellor, te nil niſi damna mereri:
Naſcitur ad viduas morio quiſque vices.
Eſt ſatius ſtulto praeſtare ſilentia rebus,
Quàm celebrare ſui ſomnia vana tori.
Quid tibi ſacrilego cum religione nepoti?
Non tibi ventriloquo creditur eſſe Deum.
Chriſticolis ſaevos hoſtes mandatur amare,
Tu cane vicinos pejus & angue necas.
O quàm laetarer, rabiem ſi cernere velles!
Virtutis ſtatuas coelica caſtra cupi!
Hoc de cive ſato dici, non ultima laus eſt,
Deſipuit coelebs, ſed ſapit ille ſenex.
Deſere tu tricis rapidum diſpendere tempus,
Ne te grandaevum vincula, reſtis, avent.
Si quid alis cultûs pauper, conſueſce labori,
Deſidiae fugito ſqualida ſigna ſequi.
Irrita ſi tibi ſint homini documenta recocto,
Et pluris paleas, quàm bona verba putes;
Sed piger, unius cenſum tu redde talenti;
Si fodias, pateris; dilapides, quid erit?
Vive, vale, felix, veteranus, & omnia praeſtes,
Quae placeant ſuperis, proficiantque tibi,
At ſi tu fracidus ſceleri ceſſare recuſas,
Ultio, cognoſcas, excubat ante fores.
Nunc claudam rivos; mihi jam ſatis arva biberunt:
Vermibus, ac cochleis, bilis, & ardor ineſt.
